questions.question_text_1: Identify the adjectival clause in the following sentence and the noun it modifies.  She wore a beautiful dress, which she had bought on her trip to Paris, and he complimented her on her impeccable style.
question_texts: Identify the adjectival clause in the following sentence and the noun it modifies.  She wore a beautiful dress, which she had bought on her trip to Paris, and he complimented her on her impeccable style.

options.option_text: Adjectival clause: which she had bought on her trip to Paris, Noun: Paris
Adjectival clause: she wore a beautiful dress, Noun: beautiful
Adjectival clause: which she had bought on her trip to Paris, Noun: dress

questions.question_text_1: In the sentence “He is staring at the world as if he has never seen it before,” the suffix -ing added to the verb “stare” indicates:
question_texts: In the sentence “He is staring at the world as if he has never seen it before,” the suffix -ing added to the verb “stare” indicates:

options.option_text: The progression of the action of staring in past time
The habituality of the action of staring in present time
The progression of the action of staring in present time
The habituality of the action of staring in past time

questions.question_text_1: Identify the implied meaning of the sentence below: (Note that the word with stress is italicized and marked in bold).  I have found my book
question_texts: Identify the implied meaning of the sentence below: (Note that the word with stress is italicized and marked in bold).  I have found my book

options.option_text: I have found my book, not yours
I have found my book, not my pen
It is I who have found my book, not anyone else
I have found my book, not lost my book

questions.question_text_1: Fill in the blanks with the appropriate options for the given subquestions.   (1)_______, the sun is a huge ball of gases. (2)_______, it has a diameter of 1.3927 million kms. It is incomprehensibly massive, and, (3)____________, it can hold millions of planets inside it. The Sun is mainly made up of hydrogen and helium gas. The surface of the Sun is known as the photosphere. (4)_________, the photosphere is surrounded by a thin layer of gas known as the chromosphere. Without the Sun, there would be no life on Earth. There would be no plants, no animals and no human beings. (5)__________, all the living things on Earth get their energy from the Sun for their survival.
question_texts: Fill in the blanks with the appropriate options for the given subquestions.   (1)_______, the sun is a huge ball of gases. (2)_______, it has a diameter of 1.3927 million kms. It is incomprehensibly massive, and, (3)____________, it can hold millions of planets inside it. The Sun is mainly made up of hydrogen and helium gas. The surface of the Sun is known as the photosphere. (4)_________, the photosphere is surrounded by a thin layer of gas known as the chromosphere. Without the Sun, there would be no life on Earth. There would be no plants, no animals and no human beings. (5)__________, all the living things on Earth get their energy from the Sun for their survival.

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct answer for blank (1).
question_texts: Choose the correct answer for blank (1).
